intro: Senecio leucostachys var. schreiteri, commonly known as the Schreiter's blueweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its blue to purple flowers and silver-gray foliage. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky outcrops. It produces small, tubular flowers arranged in a cylindrical inflorescence, which attracts various pollinators. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
